prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: My mentor who has never known defeat in 35 years. A legendary prosecutor.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Prosecutor in Embassy staff killing case. Accused by Rell of being the Yatagarasu.
Character 2
Name: Deid Mann
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. Was gunned down in front of Embassy by Rell.
Character 3
Name: Mack Rell
Description: Embassy staff killing suspect. Arrested on suspicion for the handgun he was carrying.
Character 4
Name: Yatagarasu
Description: Real identity is unknown, but claims to be a noble thief. Infiltrated the Embassy.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Kay Faraday
Description: A girl with a balloon. During the recess, she asked me to change some coins for her.
Character 6
Name: The Judge
Description: Judge in Embassy staff killing case.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.
Character 8
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Lawyer of embassy staff killing defendant, Rell. I was to battle her in court.
Character 9
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. Was called in to be expert witness on the Yatagarasu case.
Character 10
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. He was the suspect in the KG-8 Incident.
Character 11
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor's daughter. Studying to be a prosecutor in Germany, back on break.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: KG-8 Incident Overview
Description: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8. [info] The headline reads: Cohdopian Embassy staff Member, Manny Coachen, Found Not Guity!
Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell. [info] Victim
Byrne Faraday (Age: 40)
Mack Rell (Age: 32)

Time of Death
September 10
Approximately 4 PM
Discovered immediately after a gunshot was heard.


Remarks About the Bodies
Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.
Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away.
Evidence 6
Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.
Evidence 8
Name: Annual Bonus Envelope
Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.
Evidence 9
Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10
Name: Det. Badd's Testimony
Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.
Evidence 11
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
Description: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar. Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.
Evidence 12
Name: Balloon Piece
Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.
Evidence 13
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.
Evidence 15
Name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
Description: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.
Evidence 16
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape. Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.
Evidence 17
Name: Surveillance Video
Description: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mr. Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Mr. Rell survived for a short time.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: From this, it is obvious that Mr. Faraday died after he shot Mr. Rell.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: And Mr. Rell, while on the brink of death, stole Mr. Faraday's knife and stabbed him.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: They struggled, and Mr. Rell used the last of his strength to counterattack Mr. Faraday.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: Those are the facts of this case.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to find one pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict.

First, I'll go through each testimony and check against the evidences to see if there's a contradiction.

Looking at the testimonies from Franziska:

Testimony 0: "Mr. Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Mr. Rell survived for a short time."
Testimony 1: "From this, it is obvious that Mr. Faraday died after he shot Mr. Rell."
Testimony 2: "And Mr. Rell, while on the brink of death, stole Mr. Faraday's knife and stabbed him."
Testimony 3: "They struggled, and Mr. Rell used the last of his strength to counterattack Mr. Faraday."
Testimony 4: "Those are the facts of this case."

Now, looking at the evidences, especially Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes). The description says:

"Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.
Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away."

Wait, so according to the evidence, Faraday was killed by a knife, and Rell by a bullet. Franziska's testimony 1 says Faraday shot Rell, implying that Rell was shot by Faraday. But if Faraday was stabbed (so he was killed with a knife by someone else), then Faraday couldn't have shot Rell. But Rell's death was from a bullet. 

Wait, but the Crime Scene Notes also state that Rell was shot from a few yards away. If Faraday was the one holding the handgun (Evidence 3 says the handgun was found in Faraday's hand), then maybe Faraday shot Rell. But according to the evidence, Faraday was stabbed, so he would have died first. But Franziska's Testimony 1 says Faraday died after he shot Rell, which would mean Rell was shot first, then Faraday stabbed, but according to the evidence, Faraday was stabbed (so he was the victim of the knife), and Rell was shot. 

Wait, the Crime Scene Notes say both died. Wait, looking again:

Evidence 5 says:

"Victim
Byrne Faraday (Age: 40)
Mack Rell (Age: 32)

Time of Death
September 10
Approximately 4 PM
Discovered immediately after a gunshot was heard.

Remarks About the Bodies
Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.
Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away."

Wait, so both Faraday and Rell are victims here? Or were they both found dead? The testimony mentions "Mr. Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Mr. Rell survived for a short time." So Franziska is saying that Faraday died first, and Rell survived a bit longer. 

But according to the evidence, Faraday was stabbed, Rell was shot. The testimony suggests that Faraday shot Rell (so Rell was shot first, then Faraday was stabbed by Rell in counterattack). But if Faraday was holding the handgun (Evidence 3 says it was found in his hand), maybe Faraday was the one who shot Rell. But if Faraday was stabbed, then he couldn't have done that unless he was stabbed after. 

Wait, the timeline here is crucial. The Crime Scene Notes mention that the gunshot was heard right before the trial was about to start again (from Evidence 10, Det. Badd's testimony). 

But according to the testimony, Franziska is arguing that Faraday shot Rell first (so Rell was shot and then, while dying, Rell took Faraday's knife and stabbed him. But Faraday died instantly from the knife? That seems conflicting. 

Wait, the testimony says Faraday died after he shot Rell. That would mean Rell was shot first, then Faraday was stabbed by Rell, but Faraday died after that. But the Crime Scene Notes say Faraday died of a knife stab. So the order would be: Faraday shoots Rell (with the handgun in his hand), Rell is shot but survives a bit, then Rell takes Faraday's knife (maybe from his pocket?), stabs Faraday, and then Rell dies from his gunshot wound. But according to the evidence, Rell's bullet was from a distance (no gunpowder burn), so maybe someone else shot Rell?

Alternatively, maybe the timeline is different. Let me check again.

Evidence 5 says Rell died of a bullet wound, and Faraday of a knife. The testimony from Franziska says Faraday shot Rell (so Rell's bullet is from Faraday's gun), then Rell stabbed Faraday with Faraday's knife. That would fit with the evidence. But the problem is, if Faraday was stabbed, then he was the one stabbed by Rell, so he would have died after being stabbed. But Franziska's testimony says Faraday died after he shot Rell, which is consistent. But the key point here is that the Crime Scene Notes mention that Rell's bullet was from a distance (no gunpowder), which would mean that the shooter wasn't in close contact. If Faraday was holding the gun (Evidence 3 says it was found in his hand), then if he shot Rell from a distance, that's possible. But then Rell, after being shot, took the knife from Faraday and stabbed him. 

Wait, but the knife (Evidence 4) is described as "Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent." So maybe the knife was part of the Yatagarasu's key. But that's aside.

The contradiction might be in the timeline. Let me see if there's another evidence conflicting.

Looking at Evidence 4: "Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent." Wait, no, Evidence 4 says "Weapon used to kill Faraday" but the description says "It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent."

Wait, the knife was found in Rell's hand, used to kill Faraday. So Faraday was stabbed by the knife that Rell had. So Faraday was stabbed by Rell, which caused his death. Rell was shot with the handgun found in Faraday's hand. 

But according to the testimony, Franziska says Faraday shot Rell first (so the bullet in Rell came from Faraday's gun), then Rell took the knife (from Faraday's possession?) and stabbed Faraday. That would make sense. 

Wait, but the Crime Scene Notes say that Rell's bullet was from a few yards away. If Faraday shot him from a distance, then that's possible. Then Rell, after being shot, took the knife from Faraday (maybe he had it in his pocket?), stabbed Faraday, and then died. 

But according to Evidence 5, Faraday's death was from the knife, so he was stabbed by Rell after being shot? Wait no, Faraday was stabbed, so he didn't get shot. Wait the description says Faraday died of a knife stab, and Rell died of a bullet. 

Wait, so Faraday's death was due to the knife, which Rell used. So Rell stabbed Faraday, then Faraday shot Rell? But that contradicts because if Rell was stabbed first, he wouldn't be able to shoot. Wait, I'm getting confused.

Wait, let me parse again:

Crime Scene Notes (Evidence 5):

- Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.

- Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest (shot from a distance).

So Faraday was stabbed by someone (Rell?), and Rell was shot by someone (Faraday? Or someone else?).

The testimonies from Franziska (Testimony 1) say Faraday shot Rell first (so Rell's bullet is from Faraday's gun). Then Rell, while dying, took Faraday's knife (maybe from his pocket) and stabbed Faraday. That would fit. Faraday was holding the gun, shot Rell, then Rell took the knife from Faraday and stabbed him, leading to Faraday's death. But then Faraday would have been shot by someone else? Wait no, Rell was shot by Faraday's gun, which Faraday was holding. So Faraday shot Rell, Rell then takes the knife (from Faraday?) and stabs Faraday, killing him. Then both die: Rell from the bullet, Faraday from the knife. That makes sense with the evidence.

But the contradiction might be elsewhere. Let me check another evidence.

Looking at Evidence 3: "Handgun found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away."

So the handgun was in Faraday's hand, and the bullet that killed Rell came from it. That supports Franziska's testimony that Faraday shot Rell. 

Wait, but then why was the knife in Rell's hand? Because he took it from Faraday and stabbed him. That would mean the knife was used on Faraday, so the knife is the murder weapon for Faraday, found in Rell's hand. That's consistent with Evidence 4: "Weapon used to kill Faraday. It was found in Rell's hand."

So the timeline would be: Faraday shot Rell with the handgun (found in his hand), Rell, while dying, took the knife from Faraday (maybe he had it on him?), stabbed Faraday, then died from his own wound. 

So according to this, the testimonies of Franziska seem to align with the evidence. But maybe there's a contradiction I'm missing.

Wait, looking at Testimony 0: "Mr. Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Mr. Rell survived for a short time."

If Faraday was stabbed by Rell (with the knife), then the stabbing would have to happen after Faraday was shot. But Faraday was holding the gun, so if he was shot first, he wouldn't be able to shoot Rell. Wait, no, the scenario is that Faraday shot Rell first (with the handgun in his hand), then Rell, while still alive, took the knife and stabbed Faraday, causing Faraday's death. So Faraday died after being stabbed, so his death wasn't instantaneous unless the stabbing was fatal immediately. 

The testimony says Faraday's death was instantaneous. If he was stabbed, maybe the knife was to the chest and caused instant death. But Rell was shot from a distance, so maybe his wound wasn't immediately fatal, so he survived a bit. That matches the testimony. 

Hmm, perhaps there's another evidence. Let me check Evidence 16: Yatagarasu's Key. It says the key turns into a knife. So the knife (Evidence 4) is part of that key. But how does that affect?

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is between Evidence 5 and Testimony 1. Let me see:

Testimony 1: "Faraday died after he shot Rell." 

Evidence 5 says Faraday died of a knife stab, Rell of a bullet. If Faraday was stabbed, then he must have been stabbed after shooting Rell. So the testimony's claim that Faraday died after shooting Rell is consistent, as he was stabbed by Rell after. 

Wait, but the problem might be in the order of deaths. If Faraday was stabbed by Rell after shooting him, then Faraday would have died after Rell? No, because Rell was shot and then took the knife. So Rell was still alive when he stabbed Faraday, so Faraday would die after Rell's stabbing, but Rell might have died later from his own wound. Wait, but the evidence says both died at the same time? Or around the same time? The time of death is listed as same for both. 

The testimony says Faraday died after shooting Rell, implying Rell was shot first, then Faraday was stabbed and died. But according to the evidence, both died at the same time (same time of death: 4 PM). So maybe the testimony's assertion about the order is conflicting with the evidence's time of death? 

Wait, the Crime Scene Notes say both were found immediately after the gunshot. The time of death is the same for both. So the testimony's claim that Faraday died after shooting Rell might not contradict, as they could have died at the same time. 

Hmm, maybe I need to look elsewhere. Let me check other evidences. 

Evidence 12: Balloon Piece. The Judge thought it was a gunshot. But the actual gunshot was from the crime. 

Evidence 14: Ms. Yew's Perfume, same as spilled in Lobby No.1. Not sure how that's relevant here.

Evidence 7: Faraday's fountain pen, left-handed. Maybe not directly related.

Wait, Testimony 3 says they struggled, and Rell used his last strength to counterattack. But according to the evidence, Rell was shot from a distance (no gunpowder burn), so maybe the shooter was not in close contact. If Faraday shot him from a distance, then Rell couldn't have struggled much before dying. But the testimony says Rell survived long enough to take the knife and stab Faraday. 

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is in the fact that the knife used to kill Faraday was found in Rell's hand (Evidence 4), which supports the testimony that Rell stabbed Faraday. So no contradiction there.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is between Evidence 5's note that Rell was shot from a distance, and the testimony that Rell was shot by Faraday (who was holding the gun). Because if Faraday was holding the gun, he could have fired it from a distance. So that's consistent. 

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me think again. 

The key contradiction might be between Evidence 5 and Testimony 1. Wait, no, they seem to align. 

Wait, let's see another angle. 

Testimony 2 says Rell stole Faraday's knife and stabbed him. But Evidence 4 says the knife was found in Rell's hand. That's consistent. 

Wait, maybe the contradiction is between Evidence 3 and Testimony 2. Evidence 3 says the handgun was found in Faraday's hand. Testimony 2 says Rell took the knife from Faraday. That's okay, since the knife and gun are separate. 

Hmm. Maybe I'm missing something. Let me check all evidences again.

Evidence 17: Surveillance Video of the murder. The gunshot was especially impactful. But the Judge thought the balloon popping was the gunshot (Evidence 12).

Alternatively, the contradiction could be between Testimony 0 and Evidence 5. 

Testimony 0: "Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Rell survived for a short time."

Evidence 5 says both died at the same time (same time of death: 4 PM). But the testimony says one died before the other. That's a contradiction. 

Ah! That's the key point. If both victims' time of death is the same (both at 4 PM), then the testimony's claim that Faraday died after Rell (since Rell survived a bit) would contradict the evidence that they died at the same time. 

Wait, let me check Evidence 5 again:

"Time of Death
September 10
Approximately 4 PM
Discovered immediately after a gunshot was heard."

So both Faraday and Rell's time of death is listed as 4 PM. The testimony says Faraday died after Rell, but if they both died at the same time, that's impossible. Therefore, the testimony's statement that Faraday died after Rell contradicts the evidence that they both died at the same time.

But if they both died at the same time, the testimony's claim about the order of their deaths (Faraday after Rell) would still hold because the stabbing happened after the shooting. However, the time of death being the same might not necessarily mean they died at the exact moment, just that they were both found dead at 4 PM. The testimony is about the order of their deaths, not the exact timing. 

Alternatively, the autopsy might have determined the time of death as the same approximate time, so the testimony's assertion that Faraday died after Rell might not be contradicted by the evidence. 

Hmm, this is tricky. Maybe I need to look for another pair. 

Wait, another angle: Testimony 1 says Faraday died after he shot Rell, so the bullet in Rell was from Faraday's gun. But Evidence 3 says the handgun was found in Faraday's hand, which aligns with that.

Evidence 5 says Faraday was stabbed, Rell shot. So the struggle would have involved Rell stabbing Faraday after being shot. But if Rell was shot from a distance (no gunpowder burn), maybe he was still able to move and take the knife.

The testimony says Faraday's death was instantaneous, so maybe he died immediately from the stabbing, while Rell took a bit longer from the bullet. But the evidence lists their time of death as the same. 

Alternatively, if the evidence's time of death is the same, the testimony's claim that one died after the other is impossible, hence contradicting. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 5 (both died at 4 PM) and Testimony 0 ("Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Rell survived for a short time"), implying different times of death. 

So the pair would be Evidence 5 and Testimony 0. 

But the user wants one pair, so I need to confirm. 

Alternatively, another possible contradiction: 

Testimony 1 says Faraday died after shooting Rell. If Faraday was the one holding the gun (Evidence 3), then that's consistent. But the Evidence 5 says Faraday died of a knife stab, so he must have been stabbed after shooting Rell. That's okay.

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair that conflicts.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see what they claim, then check the evidences to find any contradictions.

Looking at the testimonies from Franziska (since all the testimonies listed are hers):

Testimony 0: States that Faraday's body fell on top of Rell's by chance.  
Testimony 1: Mentions the bodies fell into a pile.  
Testimony 2: Suggests they attacked each other at the same time.  
Testimony 3: Reiterates the simultaneous attack from close range.  
Testimony 4: Dismisses the order of the bodies as irrelevant.  

Now, checking the evidences. Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes) has remarks about the bodies. It says Faraday died from a knife stab, Rell from a bullet. The bullet was fired from a few yards away (no gunpowder burn on Rell's clothes). Also, the time of death is the same for both, discovered right after a gunshot.

Wait, if Rell was shot from a few yards away, that implies the shooter wasn't in close contact. But Franziska's testimony (Testimony 3) says they attacked at the same time from close range. That seems conflicting. The evidence says Rell was shot from a distance, which contradicts the close-range attack claim.

Another point: If Faraday was stabbed, and Rell was shot, but Franziska says they attacked each other simultaneously, that might not align. Because if Faraday was shot first, he might not have been able to stab Rell. But according to Evidence 5's remarks, Faraday died from the knife, Rell from the bullet. The order of deaths might matter here.

Wait, Testimony 0 says Faraday's body was on top of Rell's. If they attacked each other at the same time, how did their bodies end up in that position? The Crime Scene Notes might indicate something about the positions, but I don't see it explicitly. However, the key contradiction is Testimony 3 stating a close-range attack, while the evidence says Rell was shot from a few yards away (so not close). That's a direct contradiction.

So the conflicting pair would be Evidence 5 (which mentions the bullet was from a distance) and Testimony 3 (claiming close-range attack). Therefore, the answer should be evidence 5 and testimony 3.

cot:
Okay, let me try to work through this problem step by step. The user wants me to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to look at all the provided characters, evidences, and testimonies and find a pair where one evidence and one testimony contradict each other.

First, let me list out the key points from the testimonies and evidences to see where there might be contradictions.

Starting with the testimonies from Calisto Yew (Character 8):

Testimony 0: "There's no one out there with a motive to kill both Mr. Faraday and Mr. Rell."
Testimony 1: "All you really have to establish is that someone had a grudge against one of the two men."
Testimony 2: "Mr. Rell, who happened to be there, became a witness to Mr. Faraday's murder."
Testimony 3: "Therefore, he was killed out of necessity, and set up to look like they had killed each other."

So Yew is suggesting that one person killed Faraday, and then killed Rell to silence him, making it look like they killed each other. This implies that there was a third party involved who had a motive against one of them and eliminated the other to cover their tracks.

Now, looking at the evidences:

Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes) states that both Faraday and Rell were victims. The notes mention that Faraday died of a knife stab, and Rell from a bullet wound. The remarks also note that Rell was shot from a few yards away (no gunpowder burn). Additionally, the evidence says that Faraday's death was from the knife found in Rell's hand, and Rell's death was from the bullet fired from Faraday's handgun (found in his hand). 

Wait, but according to the testimony from Franziska (Testimonies 0-4 earlier), she argued that they attacked each other, but that might not be directly relevant here. The current question is about Yew's testimonies and the evidences.

Looking at Evidence 3 (Handgun): This was found in Faraday's hand, and the bullet that killed Rell was fired from it. Evidence 4 (Knife) was found in Rell's hand and killed Faraday. 

If Yew's testimony is that a third party killed both, then the physical evidence (E5, E3, E4) suggests that each had the weapon that killed the other in their hand. That would support the idea that they killed each other, which contradicts Yew's claim that a third party did it to make it look like mutual combat. 

So the contradiction is between Evidence 5 (and related E3 and E4) and Testimony 3 by Yew. Because the evidence shows that each had the weapon that killed the other, implying they killed each other, while Yew's testimony suggests a third party did it to frame them.

Wait, but the user's question specifies to pick only one pair. Let me confirm:

The key point is Testimony 3 says the killer set up the scene to look like mutual killing. But the evidence (Crime Scene Notes) shows that the bodies and weapons are consistent with mutual combat (each holding the weapon that killed the other). So the evidence supports the mutual combat scenario, contradicting Yew's claim that it was staged by a third party.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 5 and Testimony 3. 

Wait, but Testimony 3 is from Yew's testimony 3. Let me check the numbering again:

The testimonies provided in the current problem are from Yew:

Testimonies:
Testimony 0: Yew's Testimony 0
Testimony 1: Yew's Testimony 1
Testimony 2: Yew's Testimony 2
Testimony 3: Yew's Testimony 3

So Testimony 3 is the one where she says they were set up to look like they killed each other. The evidence (E5) shows that the crime scene notes support that they did kill each other, which contradicts Yew's assertion that it was a setup by a third party. Hence, the contradiction is between Evidence 5 and Testimony 3.

Alternatively, maybe there's another evidence that's more direct. Let me check other evidences again:

Evidence 2 (Det. Gumshoe's testimony) says he didn't hear a struggle, but that might not directly contradict. Evidence 12 (Balloon Piece) explains the gunshot was a balloon, but that's about the timing of when the gunshot was heard. 

The key contradiction is between the crime scene notes (E5) and Yew's Testimony 3. So the answer should be Evidence 5 and Testimony 3 (which is the fourth testimony listed here, but in the problem's listing, Testimony 3 is the last one from Yew). 

Wait the problem's Testimonies section here lists only Yew's four testimonies. So Testimony 3 is the one stating the setup. The evidence (E5) supports mutual combat, contradicting that.

Therefore, the correct pair is evidence 5 and testimony 3.
